gloss: the property of a more than adequate quantity or supply / the state of needing something that is absent or unavailable
the property of a more than adequate quantity or supply
a body of water between Greenland and northeastern Canada; connected with the Arctic Ocean to the north and with the Atlantic Ocean (via the Labrador Sea) to the south; icebound in winter

a complex neural network in the central core of the brainstem; monitors the state of the body and functions in such processes as arousal and sleep and attention and muscle tone / a prolonged shortage / an area of the cortex including the precentral gyrus and the postcentral gyrus and combining sensory and motor functions / localization of function on either the right or left sides of the brain / the property of a more than adequate quantity or supply / the state of needing something that is absent or unavailable

a junction of highways on different levels that permits traffic to move from one to another without crossing traffic streams / a part of a road that has been widened to allow cars to pass or park / having a lane for traffic in each direction and a center lane for passing / having a median strip or island between lanes of traffic moving in opposite directions / one of the two sides of a motorway where traffic travels in one direction only usually in two or three lanes / the aggregation of things (pedestrians or vehicles) coming and going in a particular locality during a specified period of time
become narrow, like a bottleneck / move smoothly and effortlessly / the passages in the nasal cavity formed by the projections of the nasal conchae

a fortress in London on the Thames; used as a palace and a state prison and now as a museum containing the crown jewels / capital of the state of Minnesota; located in southeastern Minnesota on the Mississippi river adjacent to Minneapolis; one of the Twin Cities / capital of the state of Wisconsin; located in the southern part of state; site of the main branch of the University of Wisconsin
